body.p: On behalf of the Rhythmbox developers, I'm happy to announce another release of the 0.11 development series. This release includes automatic GStreamer plugin installation, better podcast feed support (including OPML and Atom) and the usual collection of minor features and bug fixes. Rhythmbox 0.11.4 now requires totem-plparser 2.21.4.

ul.li: Improved Podcast feed support, including Atom and APML
Add optional mozilla plugin to handle itms:// links
Fade volume when pausing and unpausing
Improve performance and stability of MTP device support
Stop putting deleted tracks on iPods in the Garbage Bin
Improvements to the Coherence-based UPnP support
Minor improvements to Python bindings for plugins

body.p: On behalf of the Rhythmbox developers, I'm happy to announce the fourth release of the 0.11 development series. This release includes support for FM radio tuners, improved playlist handling for generic audio player devices, and the usual assortment of bug fixes and improvements.

ul.li: Allow drag-and-drop of images to the cover art display
Allow DAAP shares to be connected to manually
Support DAAP smart playlists and radio streams
Handle file names being passed on the command line again
Add "donate to artist" action to Jamendo plugin
Improvements and fixes to the cross-fading player
Improve track importing, especially on generic audio players
Allow python plugins to use threads

Support playback from fm radio tuner cards

body.p: On behalf of the Rhythmbox developers, I'm happy to announce the third release of the new 0.11 development series. This release includes partial support for UPnP A/V using Coherence, the ability to send tracks played on your ipod to last.fm and a heap of bug fixes and minor improvements.

large memory usage reductions for the Jamendo plugin
read some keys from .is_audio_player files, like Banshee
handle playlist-paths given to us by HAL better
allow plugins to add new play orders
notify last.fm about songs played on iPods

body.p: On behalf of the Rhythmbox developers, I'm happy to announce the second release of the new 0.11 development series. This release includes support for MTP portable audio players, more lyric sites, and the usual variety of bug fixes and improvements.

ul.li: make gapless/xfade playback and visualisations work together better
make Magnatune/Jamendo loading intro saner on small screens
allow the user of Magnatune gift cards
do iPod DB saving in the background, not blocking the UI
vastly reduce the Jamendo plugin's memory usage
add support for MTP audio players
clean up the playback preferences UI
update play count, rating and last played on iPods
add support for multiple lyrics sites, and allow editing of lyrics

body.p: Plus the usual other bug fixes and minor improvements.

On behalf of the Rhythmbox developers, I'm happy to announce the first release of the new 0.11.0 development series. Rhythmbox 0.11.0 "Rough in the diamond" has several new features, both user-visible and in the back end.

Rhythmbox now has a gapless-playback / crossfading playback backend, although it is not currently enabled by default, due to some known issues (particularly with visualisation). Thanks to Andreas Nilsson and Hylke Bons we have some shiny new Tango-style icons, which make Rhythmbox look better.

We have also fixed a number of issues which were causing the application to wake up the CPU while idle, allow plugins to add GStreamer filters/tee'd elements and write modified playlists back to iPods.

Add preliminary support for Vala plugins
plus a heap of bug fixes and minor improvements

body.p: The changes are too numerous to list here, but the main focuses have been on stability and memory usage. So your Rhythmbox should be even more stable, and less resource hungry.

Rhythmbox has moved its development tree back to GNOME's CVS servers, which means it's easier to get a hold of it for people who want to live on the cutting-edge. body.p: If I had to summarize the development since 0.6, I would say it's just like Rhythmbox, only better :) From stuff like Ogg support for internet radio, ReplayGain support, and automatic playlists based on rating, what we've done is just generally try to flesh everything out. We are also showcasing GStreamer's cool features like metadata reading.

However, we are set for some major changes in 0.9 (working to 1.0). File monitoring is already done, we have work going on for a SQLite backend, there's code to implement an Icecast source, and with software like HAL, the (still experimental) iPod support should start shaping up. And with luck we'll get metadata writing via GStreamer done :)

body.p: Here's a new version in the Rhythmbox development series. We're rapidly approaching 0.8.0. A lot of bugs have been fixed.

I'd like to take this space to explain what's going on with tag editing. The situation is that almost all the work that needs to be done for this inside Rhythmbox is already done. What needs to be done now is for the underlying media library like GStreamer or Xine to support it. GStreamer's actually getting pretty close, and you may even see it in the GStreamer 0.8.0 series.
